title: Requires that appointment of members of New York city water board be appointed by mayor with advice and consent of city council and not be an employee of such city
summary: Requires that appointment of members of the New York city water board be made by the mayor with the advice and consent of the city council; provides that such a member shall not be an employee of such city.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3310

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 24, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. BRENNAN, CLARK, MAISEL, JAFFEE -- Multi-Sponsored
         by  --  M. of A.  ABBATE, AUBRY, COLTON, COOK, GLICK, HEASTIE, JACOBS,
         ORTIZ, PHEFFER, SWEENEY -- read once and referred to the Committee  on
         Corporations, Authorities and Commissions

       AN  ACT  to  amend the public authorities law, in relation to members of
         the New York city water board and the manner of their appointment

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision 2 of section 1045-f of the public authorities
    2  law, as added by chapter 513 of the laws of 1984, is amended to read  as
    3  follows:
    4    2.  The  water  board  shall consist of seven members appointed by the
    5  mayor WITH THE ADVICE AND CONSENT OF THE CITY COUNCIL.  Terms of  office
    6  of  the  members shall be two years except that the terms of four of the
    7  board members first appointed shall be one year.  At  least  one  member
    8  shall  have  experience in the science of water resource development. No
    9  member shall be a director of the authority OR AN EMPLOYEE OF  THE  CITY
   10  OF  NEW YORK.  The mayor shall appoint a chairman from among the members
   11  of the board. All members shall continue  to  hold  office  until  their
   12  successors are appointed and qualified. Vacancies shall be filled in the
   13  manner  provided  for original appointments. Vacancies, occurring other-
   14  wise than by expiration of term of office, shall be filled in  the  same
   15  manner as original appointments for the unexpired terms.
   16    S  2.   This act shall take effect immediately provided, however, that
   17  it shall not be deemed to affect the tenure or qualifications as such of
   18  any member of the New York city water board on the date  upon  which  it
   19  shall  have become a law during the remainder of his or her then current
   20  term.


        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
